Article.ArticleTitle: Quantifying determinants of ozone detoxification by apoplastic ascorbate in peach (Prunus persica) leaves using a model of ozone transport and reaction.

AbstractText: Ascorbate in leaf apoplast (ASC<sub>apo</sub> ) reacts with ozone (O<sub>3</sub> ) and thereby reduces O<sub>3</sub> flux reaching plasmalemma (F<sub>pl</sub> ). Some studies have shown significant protection of cells from O<sub>3</sub> by ASC<sub>apo</sub> , while others have questioned its efficacy. Hypothesizing that the protection by ASC<sub>apo</sub> depends on other variables, we quantified determinants of O<sub>3</sub> detoxification with a model of O<sub>3</sub> transport and reaction in apoplast. The model determines ascorbic acid concentration in apoplast (AA<sub>apo</sub> ) using measured values of O<sub>3</sub> concentration (c<sub>o</sub> ), leaf tissue ascorbic acid concentration (AA<sub>leaf</sub> ), cell wall thickness (L<sub>3</sub> ), apoplastic pH (pH<sub>apo</sub> ), and stomatal conductance (G<sub>sw</sub> ). We compared the measured and model-estimated AA<sub>apo</sub> in leaves of peach (Prunus persica) grown in open-top chambers under non-filtered air (NF) and elevated (EO<sub>3</sub> : NF + 80 ppb) O<sub>3</sub> concentrations. The estimated AA<sub>apo</sub> in individual leaves agreed well with the measured values (R<sup>2</sup>  = .91). Analyses of the simulation results yielded the following findings: (a) The efficacy of O<sub>3</sub> reduction with ASC<sub>apo</sub> as quantified by fractional reduction (ϕ<sub>3</sub> ) of O<sub>3</sub> flux at the surface of plasmalemma (F<sub>pl</sub> ) was lowered from 70% in NF to 40% in EO<sub>3</sub> due to the reduction of L<sub>3</sub> . The EO<sub>3</sub> reduced AA<sub>apo</sub> , but the lower G<sub>sw</sub> and L<sub>3</sub> in EO<sub>3</sub> increased AA<sub>apo</sub> resulting in no significant change in AA<sub>apo</sub> due to EO<sub>3</sub> . ϕ<sub>3</sub> can be calculated with measured values of AA<sub>apo</sub> and L<sub>3</sub> , and F<sub>pl</sub> can be estimated with the measurement-based ϕ<sub>3</sub> . (b) When c<sub>0</sub> is increased, F<sub>pl</sub> increased curvilinearly with the increase of F<sub>st</sub> : nominal O<sub>3</sub> flux via stomatal diffusion, exhibiting apparent threshold on F<sub>st</sub> . The deviation of F<sub>pl</sub> from F<sub>st</sub> became greater when L<sub>3</sub> , pH<sub>apo</sub> , and AA<sub>leaf</sub> were increased. The quantification of ϕ<sub>3</sub> and F<sub>pl</sub> using leaf traits shall facilitate the understanding of the mechanisms of differential plant sensitivity to O<sub>3</sub> and improve quantification of the O<sub>3</sub> impacts on plants.
